question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: extract_network_configs()] [Panic DoS] Can an attacker craft a NodeConfig that triggers the panic condition for mutual_authentication to crash the node during initialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: extract_network_ids()] [Network ID duplication] Does this function detect duplicate network IDs across validator and full node networks, or can duplicates cause message routing confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: create_peers_and_metadata()] [Metadata corruption] Can concurrent modifications to the shared PeersAndMetadata Arc cause race conditions in peer authentication or discovery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: create_peers_and_metadata()] [Network isolation breach] Can the global peers_and_metadata structure leak information between isolated networks (validator vs public)? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: setup_networks_and_get_interfaces()] [Validator network uniqueness] Can the panic checks on lines 297, 310, and 324 be bypassed to allow multiple validator networks, causing consensus message routing confusion? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: setup_networks_and_get_interfaces()] [Consensus handle race] Is there a race condition between checking consensus_network_handle.is_some() and setting it, allowing multiple validator networks to register? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: setup_networks_and_get_interfaces()] [DKG handle race] Can concurrent network setup create multiple DKG network handles despite the is_some() check on line 309? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: setup_networks_and_get_interfaces()] [JWK handle race] Is the jwk_consensus_network_handle uniqueness check (line 322) atomic, or can race conditions allow multiple JWK consensus networks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: setup_networks_and_get_interfaces()] [Observer network confusion] Can consensus_observer_network_handles contain multiple handles for the same network_id, causing message duplication? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: setup_networks_and_get_interfaces()] [Network runtime leak] Are the network_runtimes properly cleaned up on failure, or can partial initialization leak runtime threads? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: setup_networks_and_get_interfaces()] [Event subscription corruption] Can the mutable borrow of event_subscription_service cause use-after-free if networks access it concurrently? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: setup_networks_and_get_interfaces()] [Handle ordering] Does the order of network handle registration matter for security, or can an attacker exploit initialization order dependencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: setup_networks_and_get_interfaces()] [Builder state corruption] Can network_builder.build() and network_builder.start() fail independently, leaving networks in inconsistent states? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: setup_networks_and_get_interfaces()] [Runtime context escape] Does the _enter guard properly constrain the runtime context, or can background tasks escape to wrong runtimes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: setup_networks_and_get_interfaces()] [Netbench runtime leak] Can the netbench runtime allocation (line 441) fail after network setup, leaving networks without proper cleanup? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: setup_networks_and_get_interfaces()] [Interface transformation corruption] Can transform_network_handles_into_interfaces fail partially, returning inconsistent interface sets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: create_network_runtime()] [Thread name collision] Can two networks with similar network_id values create runtime threads with identical names, causing thread management confusion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: create_network_runtime()] [Thread count exhaustion] Can network_config.runtime_threads be set to extreme values causing system resource exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: create_network_runtime()] [Runtime panic propagation] If spawn_named_runtime panics, are network resources properly cleaned up or do they leak? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: register_client_and_service_with_network()] [Deserialization bomb] Can max_parallel_deserialization_tasks be set to extreme values causing CPU exhaustion during message deserialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: register_client_and_service_with_network()] [Out-of-order delivery exploit] Can allow_out_of_order_delivery be exploited in consensus contexts to reorder messages and violate safety? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: register_client_and_service_with_network()] [Generic type confusion] Can the generic type parameter T be exploited to register applications with mismatched message types? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: register_client_and_service_with_network()] [Network builder mutation] Can concurrent calls to this function cause race conditions in network_builder state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: register_client_and_service_with_network()] [Deserialization concurrency] Is max_parallel_deserialization_tasks properly bounded to prevent thread pool exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/network.rs] [Function: transform_network_handles_into_interfaces()] [Consensus handle unwrap] Can the .map() operations cause silent failures if consensus_network_handle is None when it should be Some? (High)
